heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A –
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – 
Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Relevant Counties) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2020.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 2. Regulation 5 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary
text_raw:
2. Regulation 5 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary 
Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Relevant Counties) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 295 of 
2020) is amended by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph 
(2): 

“(2) A person shall not organise, or cause to be organised, a funeral to 
be held in a relevant county other than where the number of people, 
excluding a minister of religion or priest (or any equivalent thereof in any 
religion), attending the funeral does not exceed 25.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

9 August, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 11th August, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [297] 3

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid - 19) 
(Relevant Counties) Regulations 2020 provide for certain 
temporary 
restrictions in County Kildare, County Laois and County Offaly because of 
Covid-19. These Regulations amend those Regulations to clarify that up to 25 
people may attend a funeral. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [297]
